TEXT.TITLE: CCC ACCEPTS BONUS BID ON SEMOLINA TO EGYPT
TEXT.BODY: The Commodity Credit Corporation, CCC, has accepted a bid for an export bonus to cover a sale of 2,000 tonnes of semolina to Egypt, the U.S. Agriculture Department said. The department said the bonus was 233.91 dlrs per tonne and was made to International Multifoods Corp. The bonus will be paid in the form of commodities from CCC stocks. The semolina is for shipment during June 1987, it said. An additional 13,000 tonnes of semolina are still available to Egypt under the Export Enhancement Program initiative announced on August 6, 1986, it said. Reuter
